dcterms:creator: Amir Rasouli
Iuliia Kotseruba
Toni Kunic
John K Tsotsos
dcterms:description: The PIE dataset provides 6 hours of continuous footage recorded at 30 frames per second in clear weather conditions. It contains different pedestrian behaviors near the crossing event time, including urban environments with various traffic flow intensities. The dataset includes bounding box coordinates for each pedestrian, the critical time where each pedestrian will cross, and their actions of crossing or not crossing the street.
dcterms:title: PIE dataset

dcterms:description: The CP2A dataset is a new simulated dataset for pedestrian action anticipation collected using the CARLA simulator. It includes nearly 55k simulated pedestrians, equivalent to 14M bounding box samples, with a focus on crossing behavior.
dcterms:title: CP2A dataset

dcterms:creator: Iuliia Kotseruba
Amir Rasouli
John K Tsotsos
dcterms:description: The JAAD dataset focuses on joint attention in autonomous driving, providing data for understanding pedestrian behavior and interactions with vehicles.
dcterms:title: JAAD dataset

dcterms:creator: Bingbin Liu
Ehsan Adeli
Zhangjie Cao
Kuan-Hui Lee
Abhijeet Shenoi
Adrien Gaidon
Juan Carlos Niebles
dcterms:description: The STIP dataset focuses on spatiotemporal relationship reasoning for pedestrian intent prediction, providing data for understanding pedestrian actions in various contexts.
dcterms:title: STIP dataset
